alert.note: Alert for Inland Brunswick; Inland New Hanover (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 9:00PM EDT until October 01 at 6:00AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: .Additional coastal flooding will continue on the Cape Fear River overnight affecting downtown Wilmington. ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level in low- lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways. * WHERE...The lower Cape Fear River including downtown Wilmington and Inland Brunswick Counties. * WHEN...Until 6 AM EDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Portions of Battleship Road and USS North Carolina Road may become impassable. In downtown Wilmington, flooding expands on Water Street from Orange Street to Red Cross Street. The lowest portions of Water Street between Princess and Orange Streets may become impassable. Flooding worsens on the lowest spots of River Road and adjacent residential roads, south of River Road Park. Route 133 at Little Mallory Creek may be flooded. Highway 421 Truck near Carolina Beach Road begins to flood. Check with local officials for any road closures or impacts. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Cape Fear River at Wilmington MLLW Categories - Minor 5.5 ft, Moderate 6.8 ft, Major 10.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 0.8 ft, Moderate 2.1 ft, Major 5.3 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 01/01 AM 6.6 1.9 2.4 N/A Minor 01/02 PM 6.0 1.3 1.2 N/A Minor 02/02 AM 5.0 0.3 1.0 N/A None 02/03 PM 5.6 0.9 0.8 N/A Minor 03/04 AM 4.9 0.2 0.9 N/A None 03/04 PM 5.3 0.6 0.6 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
